headline.main: NONSMOKERS: 33 MILLION DOWN, 53 MILLION TO GO

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: On the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the publication of the landmark Surgeon General's ''Report on Smoking and Health,'' the American Lung Association congratulates the 33 million Americans who have quit smoking and, in effect, saved their own lives. The 1964 Surgeon General's report presented conclusive evidence of the link between smoking and a variety of debilitating and fatal diseases, such as lung cancer, emphysema, chronic bronchitis and heart disease.
